newsitem.title: CANADA: Shell Canada buyback to total C$976 mln.
newsitem.headline: Shell Canada buyback to total C$976 mln.

text.p: Shell Canada Ltd said on Tuesday it expected to purchase C$976 million worth of its stock based on preliminary results of its previously announced buyback.
Shell Canada, the Canadian integrated oil arm of Royal Dutch/Shell Group, said the offer to shareholders was oversubscribed and that it expected to buy 16 million of its shares at C$61 each.
The purchase would represent about 14.2 percent of its outstanding shares.

Shell Canada said shares tendered to the buyback's auction tender would be subject to a prorationing factor of 74 percent, while those tendered to the proporationate tender would be prorationed by 14 percent.
However, the data and purchase price were still subject to a final confirmation, expected May 30, the company, Canada's third largest oil and gas production and refining and marketing company, said.
Payment for the shares was expected to be made on June 2.
Shell Canada said in April that Royal Dutch/Shell, which owns about 78 percent of the Canadian firm, would tender the amount of stock necessary for maintaining the same percentage of ownership.
Shell Canada shares were halted on the Toronto Stock Exchange for the buyback result announcement. They were trading at 59.45, down 0.20, before the halt. ((Reuters Calgary Bureau (403) 531-1624))
